briefdescription.para: Clockwise orientation.
Counter-clockwise orientation.
Curve orientation.
Constructor for QgsCurve.
Adds a curve to a painter path.
Returns the vertices adjacent to a specified vertex within a geometry.
Returns a QPolygonF representing the points.
Returns the closure of the combinatorial boundary of the geometry (ie the topological boundary of the geometry).

detaileddescription.para:
For instance, a polygon geometry will have a boundary consisting of the linestrings for each ring in the polygon.
boundary for geometry. May be null for some geometry types.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns the minimal bounding box for the geometry.
Cast the geom to a QgsCurve.

detaileddescription.para: Should be used by qgsgeometry_cast<QgsCurve *>( geometry ).

simplesect.para: Not available in Python. Objects will be automatically be converted to the appropriate target type.

briefdescription.para: Clones the geometry by performing a deep copy.
Retrieves the sequence of geometries, rings and nodes.
Returns a new curve representing a substring of this curve.

detaileddescription.para: The startDistance and endDistance arguments specify the length along the curve which the substring should start and end at. If the endDistance is greater than the total length of the curve then any "extra" length will be ignored.
If z or m values are present, the output z and m will be interpolated using the existing vertices' z or m values.

briefdescription.para: Returns a new line string geometry corresponding to a segmentized approximation of the curve.

detaileddescription.para:
tolerance
segmentation tolerance
toleranceType
maximum segmentation angle or maximum difference between approximation and curve
Uses a MaximumAngle tolerance of 1 degrees by default (360 segments in a full circle)

briefdescription.para: Draws the curve as a polygon on the specified QPainter.
Returns the end point of the curve.
Checks whether this curve exactly equals another curve.
Returns an interpolated point on the curve at the specified distance.

detaileddescription.para: If z or m values are present, the output z and m will be interpolated using the existing vertices' z or m values.
If distance is negative, or is greater than the length of the curve, a nullptr will be returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the curve is closed.
Returns true if the curve is a ring.
Returns next vertex id and coordinates.

parameterdescription.para: initial value should be the starting vertex id. The next vertex id will be stored in this variable if found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of points in the curve.
Returns the curve's orientation, e.g.

simplesect.para: The result is not predictable for non-closed curves.

briefdescription.para: Returns count of parts contained in the geometry.
Returns the point and vertex id of a point within the curve.

parameterdescription.para: node number, where the first node is 0
will be set to point at corresponding node in the curve
will be set to the vertex type of the node

simplesect.para: true if node exists within the curve

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of points within the curve.
Returns a reversed copy of the curve, where the direction of the curve has been flipped.
Returns the number of rings of which this geometry is built.
Returns a geometry without curves.

detaileddescription.para:
Caller takes ownership
tolerance
segmentation tolerance
toleranceType
maximum segmentation angle or maximum difference between approximation and curve

briefdescription.para: Returns the curve sinuosity, which is the ratio of the curve length() to curve straightDistance2d().

detaileddescription.para: Larger numbers indicate a more "sinuous" curve (i.e. more "bendy"). The minimum value returned of 1.0 indicates a perfectly straight curve.
If a curve isClosed(), it has infinite sinuosity and will return NaN.

briefdescription.para: Returns the starting point of the curve.
Returns the straight distance of the curve, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the direct/euclidean distance between the first and last vertex of the curve. (Also known as "as the crow flies" distance).

briefdescription.para: Sums up the area of the curve by iterating over the vertices (shoelace formula).
Returns the geometry converted to the more generic curve type.

detaileddescription.para:
E.g. QgsLineString -> QgsCompoundCurve, QgsPolygon -> QgsCurvePolygon, QgsMultiLineString -> QgsMultiCurve, QgsMultiPolygon -> QgsMultiSurface
the converted geometry. Caller takes ownership

briefdescription.para: Returns the point corresponding to a specified vertex id.
Returns the number of vertices of which this geometry is built.
Returns the vertex number corresponding to a vertex id.

detaileddescription.para: The vertex numbers start at 0, so a return value of 0 corresponds to the first vertex.
Returns -1 if a corresponding vertex could not be found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the x-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0

simplesect.para: x-coordinate of node, or 0.0 if index is out of bounds

briefdescription.para: Returns the y-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0

simplesect.para: y-coordinate of node, or 0.0 if index is out of bounds

briefdescription.para: Returns number of child geometries (for geometries with child geometries) or child points (for geometries without child geometries - i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
curve / point)
used for vertex_iterator implementation
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns point at index (for geometries without child geometries - i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
curve / point)
used for vertex_iterator implementation
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Clears any cached parameters associated with the geometry, e.g., bounding boxes.
